intro: Anacampseros spuria, commonly known as the desert cactus or the spur cactus, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and ability to store water. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and can survive in extreme drought conditions. Its flowers are often yellow or orange, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Anacampseros spuria is well adapted to desert environments, making it a hardy and resilient species.
